meanings.definition: The state or quality of being shaky or unsteady.
meanings.sent1: Her shakiness made it hard to walk steadily.
meanings.sent2: The old bridge swayed with shakiness in the wind.
meanings.sent3: His shakiness during the speech made the audience giggle.
meanings.sent4: The shakiness of the ground felt like dancing on jelly.
meanings.sent5: The shakiness of the table was a constant annoyance.

meanings.definition: A feeling of nervousness or instability.
meanings.sent1: The shakiness in her voice revealed her anxiety.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't hide the shakiness in his hands during the interview.
meanings.sent3: The shakiness in his knees made him look like a wobbly penguin.
meanings.sent4: The shakiness of the situation made everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent5: Her shakiness before the exam was palpable.

meanings.definition: The tendency to tremble or vibrate.
meanings.sent1: The shakiness of the leaves in the breeze was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent2: His shakiness was visible as he held the delicate glass.
meanings.sent3: The shakiness of the phone made it hard to type a message.
meanings.sent4: The shakiness of the ground felt like a gentle earthquake.
meanings.sent5: The shakiness of the engine hinted at a deeper issue.
